page.title: 04Farming around Harberton
page.content: The whole of the area is farmland with about half being tenanted farms belonging to one landowner - a remnant of the old Estates, the rest being privately owned holdings. It has been traditionally a dairy and livestock area, because of the climate (mild damp conditions produce an abundance of good grass) and the rolling, sometimes steep terrain. However recently with modern machinery and economic pressures more farms are growing cereal crops. The farms are generally family run roughly 200 acres on average, normally only employing one full/part time worker,with additional student or casual help.Therefore much work is contracted out or expensive farm machinery co-operatively used.
